definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: a tapir found in Malaya and Sumatra.
sentences.chinese: 产于马来半岛和苏门答腊岛的貘。

sentences.english: Singapore is at the south most end of the railway network of the Malay Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡位于马来半岛铁路网的最南端。

sentences.english: This purging operation soon found its way into other parts of Malaya as well.
sentences.chinese: 这种清洗行动很快蔓延到马来半岛的其他地方。

sentences.english: It was commonly used by Chinese seafarers travelling along the Malay peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 它成了马来半岛一带中国船只普遍使用的航海仪器。

sentences.english: The Malay peninsula main cities of long-distance taxi billing some chronologically.
sentences.chinese: 马来半岛主要城市间的长途的士计费有的按时间计。

sentences.english: The beaches in Malaysia are superior to those in the Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 马来西亚位于马来半岛上的一个地区。

sentences.english: The zoo also has two siamangs from the Malay peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 动物园中还有两只来自马来半岛的合趾长臂猿。

sentences.english: The Malay Peninsular was occupied by Japan from 1942 to 1945.
sentences.chinese: 马来半岛在1942年到1945年被日本占领。

definition: Kalimantan island (Indonesian name for Borneo island)
Borneo island (of Indonesia, Malaysia and Brunei)
Sumatra, one of the Indonesian islands
Indochina (old term, esp. colonial period)/now written 中南半島|中南半岛[Zhong1 nan2 Ban4 dao3]
pinyin: Yin4 du4 zhi1 na4 Ban4 dao3

definition: Sarawak, state of Malaysia in northwest Borneo 婆羅洲|婆罗洲
variant of 蘇門答臘|苏门答腊[Su1 men2 da2 la4]

pinyin: Ma3 da2 jia1 si1 jia1 Dao3
